author: wsjcom
title: Pursue Returns, not Politics
text:
Holman Jenkins rightly raises the point that “CEOs and Politics Are a Bad Mix” (Business World, March 7). Larry Fink’s demand to 1,000 CEOs of companies BlackRock is invested in that they must “serve a social purpose” would be called schoolyard bullying in earlier times. As an investor, I want my CEOs focused on exceptional, persistent financial results—not the cause of the day. If I were king, corporate charitable donations wouldn’t be tax deductible. Let the stockholders decide how to donate their money. Don’t decide for me.
